HediffDef.label: Jurgen
HediffDef.description: stinky lmao

HediffDef.label: nearby psychic blank
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby psychic blank is dampening psychic sensitivity.

HediffDef.label: nearby psychic blank
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby psychic blank is dampening psychic sensitivity.

HediffDef.label: latent psychic
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: latent psychic
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: latent psychic
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: latent psychic
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: latent psychic
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: recently awakened
HediffDef.description: Tracks whether a latent psychic has met awakening conditions.

HediffDef.label: freshly awakened
HediffDef.description: A brief supercharge to one's mental and physical abilities brought on as a byproduct of awakening. After the rush ends, it is followed by an adjustment period lasting roughly three days, during which one's consciousness becomes limited.

HediffDef.label: awakening
HediffDef.description: Wouldn't you like to know, weatherboy?

HediffDef.label: psychic chanshi
HediffDef.description: The physical needs of awakened chanshi are taken care of by meditation.

HediffDef.label: psychic incarnate
HediffDef.description: The minds and bodies of awakened incarnates improve with every psycast known.

HediffDef.label: awakened luminary
HediffDef.description: Awakened luminaries emit an aura that improves psycasting abilities.

HediffDef.label: psycasting beacon
HediffDef.description: The "psycasting beacon" gene emits an aura that improves the psycasting abilities of those nearby, but does not affect oneself.

HediffDef.label: awakened luminary effect
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby awakened luminary improves psycasting.

HediffDef.label: archic syzygy
HediffDef.description: Vastly reduces neural heat gain and completely refunds psycasts' psyfocus costs.

HediffDef.label: psy-assisted mastication
HediffDef.description: Awakened siphoners eat faster, since part of the food dissolves into psychic immateria instead of needing to be chewed.

HediffDef.label: psychic titan
HediffDef.description: Psychic energy channeled through the body, improving its capabilities and defenses.

HediffDef.label: psychic body reinforcement
HediffDef.description: Psychic energy channeled through the body, improving its capabilities and defenses.

HediffDef.label: undying energy barrier
HediffDef.description: Awakened undying defer damage taken to their psyfocus.

HediffDef.label: archite transcendence
HediffDef.description: The archites present within this person will eventually inflict transcendence.

HediffDef.label: transcendent
HediffDef.description: Transcendence permanently boosts consciousness.

HediffDef.label: transcendent albatross
HediffDef.description: The albatross mastered the riding of the winds long before man dreamed of flight. Tribal folklorists invoke its name to describe psychics surrounded by barriers of living wind.

HediffDef.label: transcendent anaconda
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the anaconda, both for its size and the indeterminate growth it exhibits throughout its life, to describe psychics that attain giant proportions.

HediffDef.label: transcendent anaconda resistance
HediffDef.description: This has to be listed separately because it caps, unlike the other stats.

HediffDef.label: transcendent animalume
HediffDef.description: Named after the microorganisms that give anima trees their luminescence, animalumes are psychics with a favored connection to the anima trees - every 1000% psyfocus they spend summons one somewhere nearby, and an anima tree will sacrifice its life to save a nearby animalume from death, healing them and skipping them to its location.

HediffDef.label: transcendent apocriton
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the fearsome, wasp-like apocriton to describe psychics with a similar degree of control over mechanoids.

HediffDef.label: transcendent control
HediffDef.description: Temporary control exerted over this entity by a transcendent apocriton. Has no effect on ultraheavy mechs.\n\nUnless a mechanitor takes control before this effect expires, this mechanoid's allegiance will revert to its original faction.

HediffDef.label: transcendent arcturan
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the arcturan sky eel and its potent shock to describe psychics whose presence visibly warps electric currents.

HediffDef.label: transcendent beaver
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the industrious, dam-building beaver to describe psychics with preternatural talent for construction and plant work.

HediffDef.label: transcendent speech
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the loud call of the bellbird, the distinctive melodies of the canary, or the wonderfully varied song of the nightingale to describe psychics with an unparalleled mastery of the Word psycasts.

HediffDef.label: transcendent bluejay
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the viciously territorial bluejay to describe those under the guardianship of an unseen, extremely violent, force.

li.label: psychic attack rush
li.description: An unseen presence attacks those near the user of this power.

HediffDef.label: bluejay power
HediffDef.description: Increased attack speed, accuracy, damage, and armor penetration.

HediffDef.label: transcendent bowerbird
HediffDef.description: Bowerbirds almost ritualistically erect complex, artful structures showcasing colorful baubles, in the hopes of finding a mate. Tribal folklorists invoke them to describe psychics whose meditative focus generates an intricate, shimmering defensive structure about themselves.

HediffDef.label: transcendent budgie
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the budgerigar, a common pet that has accompanied humanity since the late second millennium, to describe psychics with preternatural talent for construction and plant work.

HediffDef.label: transcendent cockatiel
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the intelligent cockatiel to describe psychics who always seem full of new ideas.

HediffDef.label: transcendent cockroach
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the hardy cockroach, which can seemingly survive without its head for an extended period of time, to describe psychics for whom grievous wounds are little issue.

HediffDef.label: transcendent cranchiid
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the translucent glass squid to describe psychics whose forms can be restored by immersion in water.

HediffDef.label: transcendent crane
HediffDef.description: The crane is a natural exemplar of poise, balance, and grace. Tribal folklorists invoke its name to describe psychics with a preternatural surfeit of the same.

HediffDef.label: transcendent diabolus
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the diabolus and its fearsome thermal weaponry to describe psychics who combust on their foes and saturate the landscape in chemfuel.

HediffDef.label: transcendent chemfuel saturation
HediffDef.description: Total saturation with chemfuel - it not only coats this character's surface, but has flowed into crevices, faulds, and orifices.

HediffDef.label: transcendent dove
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke a common symbol of peace to describe those whose very presence sparks supernatural good mood, while also warding away ill omen.

HediffDef.label: transcendent dulosis
HediffDef.description: This being has been forced into new life by a dulotic transcendent. It has only a limited time to live.\n\nAny curative effect of sufficient power (such as a healer serum) can remove this forced lifespan.

HediffDef.label: transcendent echinoid
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the spike-covered sea urchin to describe psychics that bring those around them to their knees in agony.

HediffDef.label: transcendent agony
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent echinoid is causing pain.

HediffDef.label: transcendent mindwrack
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby and hostile transcendent echinoid has a potentially lethal effect.

HediffDef.label: transcendent eiderduck
HediffDef.description: The down of the eider duck provides exemplary insulation. Tribal folklorists invoke the eider duck's name to describe psychics whose mere presence wards off dangerous temperatures.

HediffDef.label: transcendent eiderdown
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent eiderduck is greatly increasing temperature resistance.

HediffDef.label: transcendent electrophorus
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the galvanic discharge of either electric eels or arcturan sky eels to describe psychics with command over lightning.

HediffDef.label: transcendent emperor penguin
HediffDef.description: Peng.

HediffDef.label: transcendent sight 2
HediffDef.description: It was so good they made another one.\n\nWait, wh- cut the transmission, cut the transmission! Someone's reading us!

HediffDef.label: transcendent blinding
HediffDef.description: A transcendent firefly's solar pinhole is projecting visual illusions that obscure this character's vision.

HediffDef.label: transcendent firehawk
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the various falcons who flush out their prey by feeding wildfires to describe psychics with "pyrokinetic" abilities.

HediffDef.label: transcendent flamingo
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the extremophile flamingo to describe psychics immune to hazardous environs.

HediffDef.label: transcendent speed
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke beings like the flying fish, the heron, the robin, or the arctic tern to describe psychics who may cross great distances with little effort.

HediffDef.label: transcendent speed
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke beings like the flying fish, the heron, the robin, or the arctic tern to describe psychics who may cross great distances with little effort.

HediffDef.label: transcendent speed
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke beings like the flying fish, the heron, the robin, or the arctic tern to describe psychics who may cross great distances with little effort.

HediffDef.label: fossilized transcendent
HediffDef.description: MISSINGNO

HediffDef.label: archobiologic part
HediffDef.description: Cyber-organic anatomy created and maintained by archites.

HediffDef.label: transcendent fulmar
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the fulmar's ability to lob oily chunks of stomach acid to describe psychics with the ability to hurl arcing projectiles of energy.

li.label: psychic siege blast
li.description: Fires an arcing energy orb that explodes on impact.

HediffDef.label: transcendent gnat
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the gnat, with its tendency to swarm in thick, opaque clouds, to describe psychics with an affinity for smog and other gases.

HediffDef.label: transcendent gnat (invisible)
HediffDef.description: Invisible while in gas.

HediffDef.label: transcendent clinging dust
HediffDef.description: The will of a transcendent gnat is causing local particulate to blind and choke this character.

HediffDef.label: transcendent goldfinch
HediffDef.description: The goldfinch is a notable member of the dawn chorus - the birds whose song accompanies the sunrise each morning. Tribal folklorists invoke the goldfinch to describe psychics who swell with restorative and protective power on a daily basis.

HediffDef.label: transcendent harbinger
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the corpse-eating harbinger tree to describe psychics that gain strength from defiling corpses.

HediffDef.label: transcendent honeybee
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the honeybee, who works its entire life to provide nourishment for others, to describe psychics whose talents spontaneously manifest food.

HediffDef.label: transcendent hornet
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the many painful stings of a hornet swarm to describe psychics surrounded by orbs of energy which assail their foes.

li.label: psychic blast
li.description: Fires an energy orb that explodes on impact. Requires at least 1 neural heat. Range scales with psychic sensitivity.

HediffDef.label: transcendent hummingbird (invisible)
HediffDef.description: Currently invisible. This invisibility is broken for one hour after attacking or casting an ability.

HediffDef.label: transcendent hummingbird
HediffDef.description: Currently not benefitting from Psychic Hummingbird. Invisibility will resume after 1 hour. Attacking or casting an ability will reset the timer.

HediffDef.label: transcendent indigo bunting
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the indigo bunting, which navigates its migratory paths by the light of the stars, to describe psychics with a potent connection to the night sky.

HediffDef.label: transcendent ivy
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the creeping ivy to describe psychics who beckon plants to climb and strangle their foes.

HediffDef.label: transcendent entangling plants
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby ivy transcendent is causing nearby plants to restrain movement.

HediffDef.label: transcendent jackdaw
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the jackdaw, with its tendency to collect unusual objects, to describe psychics whose meditative focus occasionally generates good events.

HediffDef.label: transcendent kea
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the irrepressible curiosity of the kea to describe psychics who fearlessly pry knowledge from the psychic field.

HediffDef.label: transcendent kingfisher
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the kingfisher to describe psychics possessed of unerring accuracy.

HediffDef.label: transcendent knapweed
HediffDef.description: The spotted knapweed secretes poisons into the ground which kill off other plants, enabling it to flourish in the open space. Tribal folklorists invoke this toxic nature to describe psychics that leech vitality and power from surrounding life.

HediffDef.label: transcendent ladybug
HediffDef.description: As it is a ubiquitous symbol of protection and health, tribal folklorists invoke the ladybug to describe psychics whose mere presence protects and heals allies.

HediffDef.label: transcendent healthiness
HediffDef.description: A powerful defensive and healing boon granted by a nearby transcendent ladybug. It decreasees bleeding, mental break threshold, and incoming damage, while increasing pain shock threshold, immunity gain rate, and healing factor.

HediffDef.label: transcendent leghorn
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the leghorn, a chicken breed with dependable and rapid egg-laying, to describe psychics who never want for food.

HediffDef.label: transcendent locust (ready)
HediffDef.description: Every 24 hours, produces a number of fragile, psychically-sensitive individuals who don't need to eat or sleep. These individuals disappear after 24 hours, just in time for the next group to spawn. Every 100% psychic sensitivity results in one 'locustspawn' per day.

HediffDef.label: Locustspawn
HediffDef.description: This being will return to nonexistence... or wherever it may have come from... after some time.

HediffDef.label: transcendent lovebug
HediffDef.description: During the mating season, lovebugs conjoin to each other, appearing as a single double-headed organism. Tribal folklorists invoke these beings to describe psychics with an inseparable doppelganger.

HediffDef.label: transcendent magpie
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the magpie, commonly regarded as a thief or as a sign of fortune, to describe psychics who seem to regularly stumble across fortunes.

HediffDef.label: transcendent mayfly
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the phenomenally short-lived mayfly to describe psychics who seem to live in a disconcertingly accelerated timeframe.

HediffDef.label: transcendent meerkat
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the meerkat, which educates its young, to describe psychics with a talent for teaching.

HediffDef.label: transcendent open-mindedness
HediffDef.description: A powerful cerebral boon granted by a transcendent meerkat.

HediffDef.label: transcendent mite
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the miniature mite to describe psychics who can shrink to a similarly small size.

HediffDef.label: transcendent mite
HediffDef.description: A state of vastly reduced size (which itself causes functional invisibility and phasing) caused by meditating as a transcendent mite. Using attacks or abilities will end this effect.

HediffDef.label: transcendent mosquito
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the blood-sucking mosquito to describe psychics who can steal the vitality of others.

HediffDef.label: transcendent musang
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the musang, which is used to process coffee cherries by eating and excreting them, to describe psychics whose digestion can produce serums in a similar manner.

HediffDef.label: transcendent hill mynah
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the hill mynah, one of the most talented vocal mimics in the animal kingdom, to describe psychics whose ability to assimilate skills and even psycasts from other individuals is frightening in its potency.

HediffDef.label: transcendent noctule
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the bats of dusk and night to describe psychics whose powers flourish in the dark.

HediffDef.label: transcendent notothen
HediffDef.description: While below 16 degrees Celsius, provides bonuses to armor and neural heat recovery rate. The lower the temperature, the stronger the bonuses.

HediffDef.label: transcendent notothen resistances
HediffDef.description: These are handled separately because otherwise they'd scale with the temperature.

HediffDef.label: transcendent oilbird
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the echolocating oilbird to describe psychics who receive information in places they've recently psycast.

HediffDef.label: transcendent echolocation
HediffDef.description: Enhanced mental aptitudes from being within one's own echolocation field.

HediffDef.label: transcendent orca
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the water-spewing, aquatic orca to describe psychics with an affinity for water.

HediffDef.label: transcendent orca
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the water-spewing, aquatic orca to describe psychics with an affinity for water.

HediffDef.label: transcendent osprey
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the protectiveness and care ospreys have for their young to describe psychics who exude a protective presence.

HediffDef.label: transcendent protection
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent osprey protect this character from harm and fatigue. Incoming damage is reduced by 5.

HediffDef.label: transcendent oxpecker
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the oxpecker, which eats ticks off the bodies of large mammals but may also feed on their blood, to describe psychics with beneficial and harmful powers over animals.

HediffDef.label: transcendent animal blessing
HediffDef.description: A powerful defensive and healing boon granted by a transcendent oxpecker. It decreasees bleeding and incoming damage, while increasing pain shock threshold, immunity gain rate, and healing factor.

HediffDef.label: transcendent animal curse
HediffDef.description: A malicious effect caused by a hostile transcendent oxpecker. It increases bleeding, pain, and incoming damage.

HediffDef.label: transcendent peacock
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the beautiful plumage and "eye spots" of the peacock to describe psychics who not only make their surroundings easier to see, but prettier too.

HediffDef.label: transcendent vision
HediffDef.description: Hallucinations caused by a nearby transcendent peacock improve vision and cause everything to look beautiful.

HediffDef.label: transcendent sight
HediffDef.description: Supernaturally increased vision brought about by transcendence.

HediffDef.label: transcendent peregrine
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the peregrine and its powerful, stunning dive to describe psychics who can render their foes insensate with any strike.

HediffDef.label: transcendent pipistrelle
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the bat and its potent echolocation to describe psychics who can similarly scan their environment with their own abilities.

HediffDef.label: transcendent pitohui
HediffDef.description: The pitohui consumes a highly poisonous diet with no issue; tribal folklorists invoke its name to describe psychics strong in body, unaffected by even the most powerful toxins.

HediffDef.label: transcendent polux
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the purifying root system of the polux tree to describe psychics who emit a soil-enhancing field while meditating.

HediffDef.label: transcendent poorwill
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the torpor of the common poorwill to describe psychics who need only rarely eat, drink, or sleep.

HediffDef.label: transcendent endurance
HediffDef.description: A nearby transcendent poorwill is reducing reliance on food, drink, rest, and fun.

HediffDef.label: transcendent ptarmigan
HediffDef.description: The ptarmigan molts seasonally, turning white in the winter and brown in the rest of the year. Tribal folklorists invoke the ptarmigan's name to describe psychics with two distinct sides.

HediffDef.label: transcendent happiness
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby happy transcendent ptarmigan offers a variety of benefits.

HediffDef.label: transcendent tumult
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby stressed transcendent ptarmigan is having a hindering effect.

HediffDef.label: transcendent quahog
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke pearl-making creatures such as the quahog to describe psychics who can meditate to craft wonders.

HediffDef.label: transcendent quelea
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the quelea and the vast flocks they form to describe psychics who generate a field of lessened gravity, allowing them and their compatriots to fly above the ground.

HediffDef.label: transcendent flight field
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent quelea is dampening gravity's pull, allowing one to remain in the air for long periods of time.

HediffDef.label: transcendent quokka
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the quokka's friendly demeanor - including its fearlessness of predators - to describe psychics who need not fear any beast.

HediffDef.label: transcendent raven
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the raven, often associated with wisdom and insight, to describe psychics beset by visions from beyond.

HediffDef.label: transcendent scarab
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the scarab and its gleaming carapace to describe psychics who generate powerful barriers of shimmering force about themselves.

HediffDef.label: transcendent scarab (on cooldown)
HediffDef.description: Currently unable to intercept damage. Recharge faster by meditating

HediffDef.label: scarlet transcendent
HediffDef.description: Psychics with the ability to synthesize luciferium are often associated with its signature color.

HediffDef.label: transcendent scrub jay
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the scrub jay and its penchant for caching to describe psychics with vast, hidden repositories of items.

HediffDef.label: sea ice transcendent
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the legendary chill of the sea ice to describe psychics with "cryokinetic" abilities.

HediffDef.label: chilling presence
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby sea ice transcendent causes a dire chill.

HediffDef.label: transcendent shearwater
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the shearwater, which can fly into typhoons and come out unscathed, to describe psychics capable of manipulating the weather.

HediffDef.label: transcendent spelopede
HediffDef.description: Every 20% psyfocus spent will create an insect hive nearby.

HediffDef.label: transcendent stoat
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the mesmerizing and erratic movements of the stoat to describe psychics who can seemingly move in just the right way to avoid harm.

HediffDef.label: transcendent stork
HediffDef.description: Spending 1000% psyfocus will create a new person with the same faction, ideoligion, and general background as this character.

HediffDef.label: transcendent strix
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the predatory, nocturnal, and ominous associations of the owl to describe psychics who wield madness as a weapon.

HediffDef.label: transcendent empowering love
HediffDef.description: A supernatural state of increased resilience and power brought about by being in love.

HediffDef.label: transcendent empowering love
HediffDef.description: The love of a transcendent swan is protecting and soothing this character.

HediffDef.label: transcendent swift
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the swift, a bird named for its immense speed, to describe psychics who fly at unparalleled speed.

HediffDef.label: transcendent tanager
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the brightly colored tanager birds to describe psychics whose bodies are altered by the vibrancy of their own artistic skill.

HediffDef.label: transcendent arctic tern (abroad)
HediffDef.description: Arctic terns travel the width of the planet each and every year on their migratory patterns. Tribal folklorists invoke their name to describe psychics who can step across continents in the blink of an eye.

HediffDef.label: transcendent thrumbo
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the thrumbo's preternaturally sharp horn to describe psychics whose melee attacks deal heavy armor-penetrating damage.

HediffDef.label: transcendent touch-me-not
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the touch-me-not, a flower that folds inwards when touched, to describe psychics that turn invisible whenever a foe strikes at them.

HediffDef.label: transcendent pudica
HediffDef.description: Invisibility, phasing, and increased speed provoked by damage taken.

HediffDef.label: transcendent toxbuzzard
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the pollution-adapted toxbuzzard and its toxin pustules to describe psychics whose very presence is corrosive.

HediffDef.label: transcendent corrosion
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent toxbuzzard is greatly increasing this character's susceptibility to disease and chemical agents.

HediffDef.label: transcendent uhu
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the uhu, which fluffs up immensely as a threat display, to describe psychics who rapidly swell in size.

HediffDef.label: transcendent vulture
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the imposing, carrion-feeding vulture to describe psychics who bring forth the bodies of the dead.

HediffDef.label: transcendent warbler
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the sedge warbler and its endless variety of songs to describe psychics who are seemingly constantly inspired.

HediffDef.label: transcendent war queen
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the war queen and its attendant swarms of urchins to describe psychics constantly surrounded by their own horde of tame beasts.

HediffDef.label: psychic queenling
HediffDef.description: This creature is bonded to a transcendent war queen.

HediffDef.label: transcendent whalehead
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the unsettling, leering visage of the whalehead stork to describe psychics who exude a storm of misery and terror.

HediffDef.label: transcendent death omen
HediffDef.description: The presence of a nearby transcendent whalehead is greatly increasing the ability to feel pain.

HediffDef.label: transcendent woodpecker (phasing)
HediffDef.description: Currently capable of moving through solid obstacles. This effect can only be maintained above 35% psyfocus.

HediffDef.label: transcendent woodpecker (inactive)
HediffDef.description: Will regain phasing once psyfocus exceeds 35%.

HediffDef.label: transcendent xerigium
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the cureall healroot to describe psychics with a gift for healing.

HediffDef.label: transcendent yellowjacket
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the many painful stings of an enraged yellowjacket to describe psychics who can harm foes with mere thought.

li.label: psychic bolt
li.description: Fires a long-ranged psychic bolt with heavy armor penetration. Range scales with psychic sensitivity.

HediffDef.label: transcendent dragonhoard
HediffDef.description: Psychic dragons steal from the psionic matrices of other psycasters they slay, creating a hoard of energy which grants psychic sensitivity, psyfocus regen, longevity, damage reduction, and regeneration.

HediffDef.label: transcendent egregore
HediffDef.description: Tribal folklorists invoke the idea of a thought-born creature to describe those whose psychic strength dictates their physical form.

HediffDef.label: egregoria
HediffDef.description: Enhanced psychic strength derived from the presence of other nearby psycasters.

HediffDef.label: psychic censure
HediffDef.description: A dam in the psychic field. It can only be cured by at least a full day's worth of meditation or gaining a new psylink level. If an erinys uses psychic censure on this character again, the dam will constrict, killing this character.

HediffDef.label: transcendent hunger
HediffDef.description: Psychic harpies can only truly be sated by the flesh of other psychics.

HediffDef.label: transcendent leviathan
HediffDef.description: Transcendent leviathans may develop new transcendences at any time.

HediffDef.label: transcendent phoenixfire
HediffDef.description: Overflowing psychic thalergy resulting from recent resurrection by a psychic phoenix. For now, any attempts to resurrect this character with the power of a psychic phoenix will explosively atomize the body instead.

HediffDef.label: transcendent seraph
HediffDef.description: In some Abrahamic traditions, guardian angels are said to have been sent to watch over people, or sometimes even communities. Tribal folklorists invoke the idea to describe a mysterious power that wards off violence, and which stays in its host's community even after their death.

HediffDef.label: transcendent seraph's revelation
HediffDef.description: A transcendent seraph's presence has temporarily rendered this character invulnerable, but simultaneously nearly incapable of doing harm. Only melee attacks will deal any damage, and even they are vastly weaker.

HediffDef.label: leering sphinx
HediffDef.description: Due to failed use of the psychic instruction ability, this character's psychic presence has become deleteriously tangled. The 'leering sphinx', as it is called by tribal folklorists, isn't harmful at the outset. However, if the condition builds up too much - due to three failed uses of psychic instruction - the victim perishes suddenly, and is nigh-impossible to revive by even the most advanced means.

HediffDef.label: transcendent empowerment
HediffDef.description: A three-day transformative coma in which one adapts to newfound psychic power.

HediffDef.label: transcendent wraith
HediffDef.description: On death, transcendent wraiths transfer their consciousnesses to another psychically sensitive non-psychic being. However, this transfer can't occur if it's been used within the last hour, nor if they've been struck by a persona weapon within the last day.

HediffDef.label: transcendent wraithform
HediffDef.description: Transcendent wraiths experience a surge of power after transferring to a new body.
